existing_features.title: Add a single configurable "public domain" setting for the frontend (e.g., an env var or a central config constant) and use it anywhere the app needs to reference its own domain/host so the domain can be changed without hunting through code.

Replace hardcoded references to the current domain where applicable, including the external logo URL host and any other occurrences of `growithtutor.com` in the React marketing header/footer and the standalone static landing page, so they can be updated to the new domain via the new domain setting (or via a clearly documented constant in the standalone page).

Update deployment documentation to include explicit instructions for changing the production domain (DNS + any Internet Computer hosting/canister URL considerations) and explicitly list all project locations that are affected by a domain change (including the standalone landing page).
Add a small “Domain Settings” checklist item or note somewhere appropriate in the app’s existing setup/checklist UX so an admin/deployer can easily verify the currently configured domain in the UI.
